history.content: Really depends on a lot of factors. I took the courses in separate semesters but both semesters I had relatively intense amounts of technical work paired with each. I would say that, if you have a solid foundational understanding of probability and discrete math and you're a proficient programmer familiar with C (or even Java), CS70 and CS61C will certainly be doable. I would note that I don't think having taken 61A/61B alone makes you a proficient programmer (it at least didn't for me). I would also note that most people don't have a strong foundation of probability going into CS70. If you don't feel that you check both those boxes, don't fret, this is still a doable but rigorous pairing of classes. It is pretty common and so long as you're not going to be heartbroken with anything but a 4.0 this semester, I think you could do it. If you're not solid on probability, not a solid programmer, and not willing to get anything except a 4.0, this will certainly be harder but again, achievable. You will probably have to devote a good amount of time learning C (personally what I felt was the biggest PITA in 61C) and you will probably have to review (or learn for the first time) a good deal of the probability underpinnings of CS70.

children.subject:
Data 8 is a corequisite for CS 88 (you have to have taken it or be enrolled in it to take CS 88), while both Data 8 and CS 88 are prerequisites to Data 100. So you'll have to start with Data 8 if you want to take either CS 88 or Data 100. 

CS 189 is meant to be much more rigorous than Data 8 and Data 100. I know someone who even took Data 100 to help prepare them for CS 189 if that says anything. So I'm not really sure if CS 189 as an alternative to Data 8 and Data 100 makes much sense.

history.content:
Hello everyone is it a good idea to take CS 70 and CS 61C in one semester ? Also I was wondering if CS 88 or Data 8 is good for Data 100 preparation as I have heavy load of class rn and I never took stats before. 

Last question, one of TA recommend me to take CS 189 if I don't want to take Data 8 and Data 100. Would that be a good choice? Any response will be appreciated. 

Thank you for taking time to read. Sorry if there is any duplication of questions?
history.subject: CS 70 and CS 61C in one semester
